results.title: Hillary Clinton’s in the House

media.caption: Hillary Clinton chatting backstage with Glenn Close, star of “Sunset Boulevard.”

results.abstract: For Broadway audiences, she’s become a familiar sight — and another reason to applaud.
results.adx_keywords: Presidential Election of 2016;Theater;Clinton, Hillary Rodham;United States Politics and Government

results.title: Obama Takes In a Broadway Show, but Shuns the Spotlight

media.caption: Former President Barack Obama and his eldest daughter, Malia, after watching a revival of Arthur Miller’s “The Price” in New York on Friday night.
media.copyright: Christopher Lee for The New York Times

results.abstract: The former president, who has kept a low profile since leaving office in January, visited New York to see “The Price” with his elder daughter, Malia.

results.title: Before ‘Moonlight’ and ‘The Walking Dead,’ a Friendship Born in the Classroom

media.caption: Danai Gurira and André Holland in a theater at New York University, where they met in the Tisch Graduate Acting Program.
media.copyright: Benjamin Norman for The New York Times

results.abstract: André Holland first saw Danai Gurira at New York University, performing a monologue she wrote. Since then, they have acted and written together.
results.adx_keywords: Gurira, Danai;Holland, Andre (1979- );Actors and Actresses;Theater;Jitney (Play);Moonlight (Movie);The Walking Dead (TV Program)

results.title: Broadway’s Bathroom Problem: Have to Go? Hurry Up, or Hold It

media.caption: A line for the women’s restroom at the Imperial Theater, where “Les Misérables” played last year, extended down the hallway and staircase and into the lobby at a performance.
media.copyright: Hilary Swift for The New York Times

results.abstract: Efforts to add stalls gain speed as the theater industry awakens to the frustration women face at intermission and to a growing expectation of comfort.
results.adx_keywords: Bathrooms and Toilets;Theater;Theaters (Buildings);Women and Girls;Restoration and Renovation;Broadway League;Ambassador Theater Group;Hayes, Helen, Theater;Hirschfeld, Al, Theater;Hudson Theater (Manhattan, NY);Jujamcyn Theaters;Schoenfeld, Gerald, Theater;Shubert Organization;Second Stage Theater;Times Square and 42nd Street (Manhattan, NY)

results.title: ‘Hamilton’ and ‘Harry Potter’ Productions Try to Outwit Scalpers

media.caption: The Harry Potter play in London has been trying to combat scalpers. The play is planning to open on Broadway next year, and hoping to contain scalping there as well.
media.copyright: Tom Jamieson for The New York Times

results.byline: By MICHAEL PAULSON and BEN SISARIO
results.abstract: As “Hamilton” heads to London and “Harry Potter” comes to New York, the two plays are experimenting with measures to limit reselling of their tickets.
results.adx_keywords: Ticket Scalping;Law and Legislation;E-Commerce;Theater;Hamilton (Play);Harry Potter and the Cursed Child (Play)

results.title: Review: That ‘Sunset Boulevard’ Close-Up, Finely Focused

media.caption: Glenn Close returns as Norma Desmond in a revival of Andrew Lloyd Webber’s “Sunset Boulevard,” at the Palace Theater.

results.abstract: The pared-down revival of the Andrew Lloyd Webber musical relies more on Glenn Close’s astounding performance than the original lavish production could.
results.adx_keywords: Theater;Sunset Boulevard (Play);Close, Glenn;Lloyd Webber, Andrew;Price, Lonny

results.title: Review: In ‘Dear Evan Hansen,’ a Lonely Teenager, a Viral Lie and a Breakout Star

media.caption: Ben Platt in the title role of the musical “Dear Evan Hansen, ” at the Music Box Theater.

results.abstract: This gorgeous heartbreaker of a musical, starring Ben Platt and directed by Michael Greif, has tragedy at its core but is anything but a downer.

results.title: A ‘Hamilton’ Star Is to Replace Josh Groban in ‘Great Comet’

media.caption: Okieriete Onaodowan, who played Hercules Mulligan and James Madison in the original Broadway cast of “Hamilton.”
media.copyright: Nicole Craine for The New York Times

results.abstract: Okieriete Onaodowan was Hercules Mulligan and James Madison in “Hamilton.” Next, he’ll play Pierre in “Natasha, Pierre & the Great Comet of 1812.”
results.adx_keywords: Theater;Onaodowan, Okieriete;Natasha, Pierre & the Great Comet of 1812 (Play);Actors and Actresses;Hamilton (Play);Groban, Josh;Chavkin, Rachel;Benton, Denee (1992- )

results.title: Sara Bareilles Will Star in ‘Waitress,’ Her Broadway Acting Debut

media.caption: Sara Bareilles, whose score for “Waitress” was nominated for a Tony Award last year, will succeed Jessie Mueller in the lead role.

results.abstract: Ms. Bareilles, who composed the music and wrote the lyrics to the hit show, will succeed Jessie Mueller in the lead role on March 31.

results.title: Review: ‘Sunday in the Park With George,’ a Living Painting to Make You See

media.caption: Jake Gyllenhaal, far left, and Annaleigh Ashford, far right, in “Sunday in the Park With George,” at the Hudson Theater.

results.abstract: Jake Gyllenhaal and Annaleigh Ashford star in the marvelous revival of Stephen Sondheim and James Lapine’s musical, at the newly restored Hudson Theater.
results.adx_keywords: Theater;Sunday in the Park with George (Play);Sondheim, Stephen;Lapine, James;Gyllenhaal, Jake;Ashford, Annaleigh;Lapine, Sarna;Seurat, Georges;Hudson Theater (Manhattan, NY)
